solidbase.config
Class Configuration

java.lang.Object
  solidbase.config.Configuration

public class Configuration
extends Object

This class represents all the configuration from the commandline or from the properties file.

Since:
Apr 1, 2006 7:18:27 PM
Author:
René M. de Bloois

Field Summary
protected  Database defaultDatabase
          The default configured database.

          A list of jars that need to be added to the classpath.

Field Detail

properties

protected Properties properties
The contents of the properties file. Default this is solidbase.properties in the current folder, with missing properties coming from solidbase-default in the classpath.

driverJars

protected List<String> driverJars
A list of jars that need to be added to the classpath.

defaultDatabase

protected Database defaultDatabase
The default configured database.

secondaryDatabases

protected Map<String,Database> secondaryDatabases
A list of configured secondary databases.

protected String target
Target version to upgrade to.

patchFile

protected String patchFile
The upgrade file to be used.

sqlFile

protected String sqlFile
The SQL file to be executed.

Constructor Detail

Configuration

public Configuration(ConfigListener progress,
                     int pass,
                     Options options)
Create a new configuration object. This constructor is used by the command line version of SolidBase.

Parameters:
progress - The listener that listens to config events.
pass - Are we in pass 1 or pass 2 of booting?
options - The options from the command line.
Method Detail

getPropertiesFile

protected File getPropertiesFile()
Returns the path of the properties file. Can be relative or absolute. Needed for testing.

Returns:
the path of the properties file.

public String getProperty(String name)

isVoid

public boolean isVoid()
Determines if the configuration is void.

Returns:
True if the configuration is void, false otherwise.
